RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 1 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 15750. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 11 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,750, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (Colts And Geldings Preferred)(*Plus Up To $540 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards).

CLAIM.OWNER: Ascot Stud Blake Sr Michael S Stout Mark and Stocker-Parks Rachel

RACE.FOOTNOTES: SOUP SPOON was hustled early, had a clear lead on the turn and from the three path at the top of the stretch held sway. HALF TO RELOAD settled off the leaders and moved up on the turn but from the four path at the top of the stretch was no match for the winner. NO MORE tracked the early leaders from the inside, was roused on the turn and finished evenly. C BY THE SEA was away alertly but trailed the field on the turn and from the four path at the top of the stretch was no real threat. MISS D'S PRIDE stalked the early leader but chased on the turn and from the three path at the top of the stretch had no late kick.

ENTRY.NAME: No More
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside, roused turn, finished evenly

ENTRY.NAME: Miss D's Pride
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked leader, chased turn, 3-path stretch, no late lick

ENTRY.NAME: Soup Spoon
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled early, clear lead turn, 3-path stretch, held sway

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Southern Chase Farm, Inc., Karen Dodd & Greg Dodd

ENTRY.NAME: C by the Sea
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, trailed turn, 4-path stretch, no real threat

ENTRY.NAME: Half to Reload
ENTRY.OWNER: Albertson Brian and The Estate of Dennis Tucker
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off pace, moved up turn, 4-path stretch, no match

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 2 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 52. Maiden Claiming Purse 15000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 122 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, if for $3,750, allowed 2 lbs. (Colts And Geldings Preferred)(*Plus Up To $540 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WIN THE DRAW stalked the early leader, was a factor on the far turn and from the six path at the top of the stretch fought gamely for the win. BREACH OF TRUST showed speed from the inside, had the lead on the far turn but drifted out through the stretch and was outgunned. LETS SAY THIS was unhurried early and raced evenly on the far turn but needed more. AMEN TO THAT was in touch and hustled along on the far turn but from the seven path at the top of the stretch had no rally. MIGHTY PELE was well back and showed nothing in a dull effort.

ENTRY.NAME: Breach of Trust
ENTRY.OWNER: Lee Ken Mitchell Dennis Bell Donald K and Bell Gaye
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed inside, led far turn, drifted out stretch, outgunned

ENTRY.NAME: Win the Draw
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked leader, factor far turn, 6-path stretch, fought gamely

ENTRY.NAME: Amen to That
ENTRY.COMMENT: in touch, hustled along far turn, 7-path stretch, no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Lets Say This
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, evenly far turn, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Mighty Pele
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back, showed nothing, dull effort

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 3 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 63. Maiden Special Weight Purse 21600. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 122 lbs. (Colts And Geldings Preferred)(*Plus Up To $4,725 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RELOAD BULLET set the pace, had a clear lead on the turn and from the three path at the top of the stretch was kept to task. BEYOND TALENTED was in touch, roused from the inside on the turn and from the four path at the top of the stretch was clearly second best. OPEECHEE tracked the early leader and had a good position on the turn but from the five path at the top of the stretch had no late kick. TONKA WAKAN was off slow, showed little and had no impact. BUSTA GROOVE was off a step slow and had a mild gain on the turn but from the six path at the top of the stretch faded.

ENTRY.NAME: Tonka Wakan
ENTRY.OWNER: Steer, Thomas R. and Walpole, Lance R.
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, showed little, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Beyond Talented
ENTRY.COMMENT: in touch, roused inside turn, 4-path stretch, clearly 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Opeechee
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked leader, good position turn, 5-path stretch, no late kick

ENTRY.NAME: Reload Bullet
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, clear lead turn, 3-path stretch, kept to task

ENTRY.NAME: Busta Groove
ENTRY.COMMENT: off step slow, mild gain turn, 6-path stretch, faded

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 4 1M Turf CR: 56. Maiden Claiming Purse 15000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 122 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, if for $3,750, allowed 2 lbs. (*Plus Up To $540 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards). If deemed inadvisable by management to run on the turf, this race will be run at a distance of One Mile and Seventy Yards on the main track.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MIZZ GEMMA was unhurried early, raced evenly from the inside on the far turn and from the four path at the top of the stretch drew clear. LADY OF THE FORT set a pressured pace, had the lead on the far turn and vied through the stretch but was outfinished. PRINCESS DIDI was in touch and roused on the far turn but from the three path at the top of the stretch needed more. LEA'S SUNSHINE was well back, trailed the field on the far turn and from the eight path at the top of the stretch was up for a share. REJOICING FOR KATZ settled off the pace and saved ground on the far turn but from the five path at the to of the stretch had no kick. LEMONSANDDIAMONDS was in range and hustled along on the far turn but from the seven path at the top of the stretch leveled off. ALWAY'S ROSIE forced the early pace and was a factor on the far turn but from the six path at the top of the stretch was empty.

ENTRY.NAME: Lady of the Fort
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace, led far turn, vied stretch, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Mizz Gemma
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, evenly inside far turn, 4-path stretch, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Princess Didi
ENTRY.COMMENT: in touch, roused far turn, 3-path stretch, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Alway's Rosie
ENTRY.COMMENT: forced pace, factor far turn, 6-path stretch, empty

ENTRY.NAME: Lea's Sunshine
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back, trailed far turn, 8-path stretch, up for share

ENTRY.NAME: Rejoicing for Katz
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off pace, saved ground far turn, 5-path stretch, no kick

ENTRY.NAME: Lemonsanddiamonds
ENTRY.COMMENT: in range, hustled along far turn, 7-path stretch, leveled off

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 69. Maiden Claiming Purse 21300. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 122 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000, if for $7,000, allowed 2 lbs. (*Plus Up To $540 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TEQUILAS MELODY was away alertly and set the pace, had a slim lead on the turn, vied through the stretch and fought gamely for the win. KIMONO KATE stalked the early leader, forced the pace on the turn and had the lead from the three path in mid stretch but was outgunned. JIMMY IS A BREEZE was unhurried early, moved up on the turn and from the five path at the top of the stretch finished well. SLOANS SKY was off the pace and saved ground on the turn but from the three path at the top of the stretch was no real threat. SPEEDY NEPHRITE was up close early but lost ground on the turn and was empty.

ENTRY.NAME: Sloans Sky
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, saved ground turn, 3-path stretch, no real threat

ENTRY.NAME: Speedy Nephrite
ENTRY.COMMENT: up close early, lost ground turn, empty

ENTRY.NAME: Tequilas Melody
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, slim lead turn, vied stretch, fought gamely

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Sheltowee Farm, Dean Hayes & MyMeadowview, LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Jimmy Is a Breeze
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, moved up turn, 5-path stretch, finished well

ENTRY.NAME: Kimono Kate
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, forced pace turn, led 3-path mid stretch, outgunned

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 6 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 73. Allowance Purse 24600. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming At A Mile Or Over Since August 11 Allowed 2 lbs. (Colts And Geldings Preferred)(*Plus Up To $4,725 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SANTIAGO SALSA was off the pace, had a mild gain on the far turn and was up in time. ERNIE'S MARTINI stalked the early leader, was a factor on the far turn and had the lead from the five path in upper stretch but was caught late. RENEGADE SERENADE was unhurried early, hustled along on the far turn and from the six path at the top of the stretch was up for show. BROADWAY RUCKUS set the pace and had the lead on the far turn but was headed at the top of the stretch and gave way. GRAND GIZMO tracked the early leader but chased on the far turn and dropped back through the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Ernie's Martini
ENTRY.OWNER: Chesney, Stephen and Hoffman, Cory S.
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, factor far turn, led 5-path stretch, caught late

ENTRY.NAME: Broadway Ruckus
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, led far turn, headed top stretch, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Santiago Salsa
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, mild gain far turn, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Grand Gizmo
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked leader, chased far turn, dropped back stretch

ENTRY.NAME: Renegade Serenade
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, hustled along far turn, 6-path stretch, up for show

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 7 7F Turf CR: 77. Claiming Purse 15750. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 11 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,750, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less N ot Considered In Allowances) (Colts And Geldings Preferred)(Limited to 10 Starters)(*Plus Up To $540 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards). If deemed inadvisable by management to run on the turf, this race will be run at a distance of Six and One Ha lf Furlongs on the main track.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: UNILATERAL was well back, gained ground on the far turn and from the eight path at the top of the stretch rallied in time. SENSIBLE PORTIONS was unhurried early and a factor on the far turn but from the six path at the top of the stretch just missed. NAVAL OFFICER set the pace and dueled on the far turn but had nothing left. SAME AGAIN DOC stalked the early leader, forced the pace on the far turn but checked in mid stretch and weakened. TIMMINS was in touch and raced evenly on the far turn but from the seven path at the top of the stretch was not a factor. RICKI TORNADO was in range but chased on the far turn and came up empty. A CLAIM OF FOUL BY THE RIDER ON SAME AGAIN DOC AGAINST SENSIBLE PORTIONS FOR INTERFERENCE IN THE STRETCH RESULTED IN SENSIBLE PORTIONS BEING DISQUALIFIED AND PLACED FOURTH.

ENTRY.NAME: Ricki Tornado
ENTRY.COMMENT: in range, chased far turn, came up empty

ENTRY.NAME: Same Again Doc
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, forced pace far turn, checked mid stretch, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Naval Officer
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, dueled far turn, nothing left

ENTRY.NAME: Timmins
ENTRY.COMMENT: in touch, evenly far turn, 7-path stretch, not a factor

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Sensible Portions
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, factor far turn, 6-path stretch, just missed

ENTRY.NAME: Unilateral
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back, gained ground far turn, 8path stretch, rallied in time

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 8 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 57. Maiden Claiming Purse 15120. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 122 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, if for $3,750, allowed 2 lbs. (Colts And Geldings Preferred)(*Plus Up To $540 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CHICAGO FREDDY was hustled early, took command on the turn and from the three path at the top of the stretch proved best. FAJARDO was in range, moved up on the turn and from the five path at the top of the stretch finished well. J M R TUREK was in range and a factor on the turn but from the four path at the top of the stretch leveled off. NGABE was well back, closed the gap on the turn and passed tired foes through the stretch. CATRIN tracked the early leaders from the inside but checked into the turn and from the four path at the top of the stretch had no impact. EL BANDOLERO was off the pace and saved ground on the turn but was never in contention. MY SONG BABY was away alertly and raced evenly on the turn but dropped back through the stretch. A STEWARDS' INQUIRY RESULTED IN J M R TUREK BEING DISQUALIFIED AND PLACE FIFTH.

ENTRY.NAME: Catrin
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside, checked into turn, 4-path stretch, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: El Bandolero
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, saved ground turn, never in contention

ENTRY.NAME: My Song Baby
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, evenly turn, dropped back stretch

ENTRY.NAME: Chicago Freddy
ENTRY.OWNER: Princeton Farms Inc Ham Nelson and Bechtal Glenn
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled early, took command turn, 3-path stretch, proved best

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Princeton Farms, G Belore & N Ham

ENTRY.NAME: Ngabe
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back, closed gap turn, passed tired foes

ENTRY.NAME: dq-J M R Turek
ENTRY.COMMENT: in range, factor turn, 4-path stretch, leveled off

ENTRY.NAME: Fajardo
ENTRY.OWNER: Sorokolit Jr William A Vandyk Sunny Stables Inc and Banach Darwin D
ENTRY.COMMENT: in range, moved up turn, 5-path stretch, finished well
